intro: Cheirinia pallasii, commonly known as the Pallas's bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, hairy seeds in its fruiting structures. Cheirinia pallasii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
